qualityCheck.name: packageId pattern matches "scope.identifier.revision"
qualityCheck.description: Check against LTER requirements for scope.identifier.revision
qualityCheck.expected: 'scope.n.m', where 'n' and 'm' are integers and 'scope' is one of an allowed set of values

qualityCheck.name: EML version 2.1.0 or beyond
qualityCheck.description: Check the EML document declaration for version 2.1.0 or higher
qualityCheck.expected: eml://ecoinformatics.org/eml-2.1.0 or higher
qualityCheck.explanation: Validity of this quality report is dependent on this check being valid.

qualityCheck.name: Document is schema-valid EML
qualityCheck.description: Check document schema validity
qualityCheck.expected: schema-valid
qualityCheck.explanation: Validity of this quality report is dependent on this check being valid.

qualityCheck.name: Document is EML parser-valid
qualityCheck.description: Check document using the EML IDs and references parser
qualityCheck.expected: Validates with the EML IDs and references parser
qualityCheck.found: EML IDs and references parser succeeded
qualityCheck.explanation: Validity of this quality report is dependent on this check being valid.

qualityCheck.name: Dereferenced document is schema-valid EML
qualityCheck.description: References are dereferenced, and the resulting file validated
qualityCheck.expected: schema-valid
qualityCheck.explanation: Validity of this quality report is dependent on this check being valid.

qualityCheck.name: keyword element is present
qualityCheck.description: Checks to see if at least one keyword is present
qualityCheck.expected: Presence of one or more keyword elements

qualityCheck.name: A 'methods' element is present
qualityCheck.description: All datasets should contain a 'methods' element, at a minimum a link to a separate methods doc.
qualityCheck.expected: presence of 'methods' at one or more xpaths.

qualityCheck.name: coverage element is present
qualityCheck.description: At least one coverage element should be present in a dataset.
qualityCheck.expected: At least one of geographicCoverage, taxonomicCoverage, or temporalCoverage is present in the EML.

qualityCheck.name: geographicCoverage is present
qualityCheck.description: Check that geographicCoverage exists in EML at the dataset level, or at least one entity's level, or at least one attribute's level.
qualityCheck.expected: geographicCoverage at least at the dataset level.
qualityCheck.explanation: Many but not all datasets are appropriate to have spatial coverage.
qualityCheck.suggestion: If sampling EML is used within methods, does that obviate geographicCoverage? Or should those sites be repeated or referenced?
qualityCheck.reference: EML Best Practices v.2, p. 22-23. "One geographicCoverage element should be included, whose boundingCoordinates describe the extent of the data....Additional geographicCoverage elements may be entered at the dataset level if there are significant distances between study sites and it would be confusing if they were grouped into one bounding box." 6 decimal places.

qualityCheck.name: taxonomicCoverage is present
qualityCheck.description: Check that taxonomicCoverage exists in EML at the dataset level, or at least one entity's level, or at least one attribute's level.
qualityCheck.expected: taxonomicCoverage at least at the dataset level.
qualityCheck.explanation: Only when taxa are pertinent to the dataset will they have taxonomicCoverage.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Could search title, abstract, keywords for any taxonomic name (huge). Could search keywordType="taxonomic".

qualityCheck.name: temporalCoverage is present
qualityCheck.description: Check that temporalCoverage exists in EML at the dataset level, or at least one entity's level, or at least one attribute's level.
qualityCheck.expected: temporalCoverage at least at the dataset level.
qualityCheck.explanation: LTER wants to search datasets by time; the best place to search is the dataset level temporal coverage.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Most datasets have a temporal range.

qualityCheck.name: An alternateIdentifier with a DOI system attribute that looks like it is generated by PASTA should not be present
qualityCheck.description: Reject the data package if it contains an alternateIdentifier DOI that looks like PASTA generated it.
qualityCheck.expected: No PASTA DOIs are expected to be found in the uploaded data package
qualityCheck.found: No PASTA DOI alternateIdentifier elements found
qualityCheck.explanation: PASTA DOI values might appear in an uploaded data package (by various mechanisms). PASTA will assign a DOI after the upload has completed successfully, so an initial one should not be there.

qualityCheck.name: Dataset title length is at 5 least words.
qualityCheck.description: If the title is shorter than 5 words, it might be insufficient. Title word count between 7 and 20 including prepositions and numbers.
qualityCheck.expected: Between 7 and 20 words

qualityCheck.name: check to see if funding element is present
qualityCheck.description: Checks to see if the funding element is included.
qualityCheck.expected: the funding element is expected to be included
qualityCheck.explanation: Searches will want to display datasets by funder or grant id.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Include the funding source, please.

qualityCheck.name: Dataset abstract element is a minimum of 20 words
qualityCheck.description: Check the length of a dataset abstract and warn if less than 20 words.
qualityCheck.expected: An abstract is 20 words or more.

qualityCheck.name: There are no duplicate entity names
qualityCheck.description: Checks that content is not duplicated by other entityName elements in the document
qualityCheck.expected: entityName is not a duplicate within the document
qualityCheck.explanation: Data Manager requires a non-empty, non-duplicate entityName value for every entity
qualityCheck.suggestion: Declare a non-empty entityName and ensure that there are no duplicate entityName values in the document

qualityCheck.name: Length of entityName is not excessive (less than 100 char)
qualityCheck.description: length of entity name is less than 100 characters
qualityCheck.expected: entityName value is 100 characters or less

qualityCheck.name: An entity description is present
qualityCheck.description: Check for presence of an entity description.
qualityCheck.expected: EML Best practices pp. 32-33, "...should have enough information for a user..."
qualityCheck.explanation: With entityName sometimes serving as a file name rather than a title, it is important to be very descriptive here.

qualityCheck.name: 'numHeaderLines' element is present
qualityCheck.description: Check for presence of the 'numHeaderLines' element.
qualityCheck.expected: Document contains 'numHeaderLines' element.

qualityCheck.name: 'numFooterLines' element is present
qualityCheck.description: Check for presence of the 'numFooterLines' element.
qualityCheck.expected: Document contains 'numFooterLines' element.

qualityCheck.name: Field delimiter is a single character
qualityCheck.description: Field delimiters should be one character only
qualityCheck.expected: A single character is expected
qualityCheck.explanation: A valid fieldDelimiter value was found

qualityCheck.name: Record delimiter is present
qualityCheck.description: Check presence of record delimiter. Check that the record delimiter is one of the suggested values.
qualityCheck.expected: A record delimiter from a list of suggested values: \n, \r, \r\n, #x0A, #x0D, #x0D#x0A
qualityCheck.explanation: A valid recordDelimiter value was found

qualityCheck.name: Is the numberOfRecords element present?
qualityCheck.description: Warn the user if the numberOfRecords check is not present
qualityCheck.expected: A number of records element is expected for this entity
qualityCheck.explanation: This is a valuable check that we have the correct table.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Add a numberOfRecords element and store the number of entity records

qualityCheck.name: Check for presence of an entity size element
qualityCheck.description: Look for entity size element as a prep for checking congruence, and if not present, generate a warn. Note that to be most useful (i.e, to check congruence), entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit); however, the presence or name of the entity size unit is NOT checked.
qualityCheck.expected: Entity size is present. If unit="byte" or unit is omitted (default = byte), then congruence can be checked.
qualityCheck.found: Found entity size element with value of 232 with no unit specified (defaults to 'byte').
qualityCheck.explanation: Examining the entity size is prep for checking congruence. Including the element is best practice, and if not present, a warn is generated. To be most useful, entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit).
qualityCheck.suggestion: Include an entity size in bytes
qualityCheck.reference: Example success: knb-lter-sbc.3.12. Example of size in units other than byte: knb-lter-mcr.6.56.

qualityCheck.name: A physical/authentication element is present and specifies a method attribute with a value of MD5 or SHA-1
qualityCheck.description: Check for presence of a physical/authentication element containing a checksum or hash value for an integrity check (e.g. MD5, SHA-1). Warn if an entity does not have a physical/authentication element, or if none of the physical/authentication elements specify a method attribute with a value of MD5 or SHA-1.
qualityCheck.expected: At least one physical/authentication element with a method attribute specifying MD5 or SHA-1 and containing a checksum or hash value that can be used to perform an integrity check on the data.
qualityCheck.explanation: PASTA will use this value to check the integrity of the data it downloads from your site. In addition, PASTA is planning to compare the contributor-supplied checksum/hash value documented in the physical/authentication element to the checksum/hash value of this entity downloaded from previous revisions of this data package. If PASTA already has a copy of this entity, it will be able to avoid an unnecessary download of the entity from your site, resulting in faster processing of the new data package revision when you update it in PASTA.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Add a physical/authentication element and store the entity checksum or hash value in it using a method such as MD5 or SHA-1.

qualityCheck.name: Attribute names are unique
qualityCheck.description: Checks if attributeName values are unique in the table. Not required by EML.
qualityCheck.expected: Unique attribute names.
qualityCheck.explanation: A good table does not have duplicate column names.

qualityCheck.description: Display the first kilobyte of data that is downloaded
qualityCheck.expected: Up to one kilobyte of data should be displayed

qualityCheck.name: Check for presence of an entity size element
qualityCheck.description: Look for entity size element as a prep for checking congruence, and if not present, generate a warn. qualityCheck.found: Found entity size element with value of 318255 with no unit specified (defaults to 'byte').
qualityCheck.explanation: Examining the entity size is prep for checking congruence. Including the element is best practice, and if not present, a warn is generated. To be most useful, entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit).
qualityCheck.suggestion: Include an entity size in bytes
qualityCheck.reference: Example success: knb-lter-sbc.3.12. Example of size in units other than byte: knb-lter-mcr.6.56.

qualityCheck.description: Check for presence of a physical/authentication element containing a checksum or hash value for an integrity check (e.g. MD5, SHA-1). Warn if an entity does not have a physical/authentication element, or if none of the physical/authentication elements specify a method attribute with a value of MD5 or SHA-1.
qualityCheck.expected: At least one physical/authentication element with a method attribute specifying MD5 or SHA-1 and containing a checksum or hash value that can be used to perform an integrity check on the data.
qualityCheck.explanation: PASTA will use this value to check the integrity of the data it downloads from your site. In addition, PASTA is planning to compare the contributor-supplied checksum/hash value documented in the physical/authentication element to the checksum/hash value of this entity downloaded from previous revisions of this data package. If PASTA already has a copy of this entity, it will be able to avoid an unnecessary download of the entity from your site, resulting in faster processing of the new data package revision when you update it in PASTA.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Add a physical/authentication element and store the entity checksum or hash value in it using a method such as MD5 or SHA-1.

qualityCheck.name: Check for presence of an entity size element
qualityCheck.description: Look for entity size element as a prep for checking congruence, and if not present, generate a warn. Note that to be most useful (i.e, to check congruence), entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit); however, the presence or name of the entity size unit is NOT checked.
qualityCheck.expected: Entity size is present. If unit="byte" or unit is omitted (default = byte), then congruence can be checked.
qualityCheck.found: Found entity size element with value of 75909 with no unit specified (defaults to 'byte').
qualityCheck.explanation: Examining the entity size is prep for checking congruence. Including the element is best practice, and if not present, a warn is generated. To be most useful, entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit).
qualityCheck.suggestion: Include an entity size in bytes
qualityCheck.reference: Example success: knb-lter-sbc.3.12. Example of size in units other than byte: knb-lter-mcr.6.56.

qualityCheck.name: A physical/authentication element is present and specifies a method attribute with a value of MD5 or SHA-1
qualityCheck.description: Check for presence of a physical/authentication element containing a checksum or hash value for an integrity check (e.g. MD5, SHA-1). Warn if an entity does not have a physical/authentication element, or if none of the physical/authentication elements specify a method attribute with a value of MD5 or SHA-1.
qualityCheck.expected: At least one physical/authentication element with a method attribute specifying MD5 or SHA-1 and containing a checksum or hash value that can be used to perform an integrity check on the data.
qualityCheck.explanation: PASTA will use this value to check the integrity of the data it downloads from your site. In addition, PASTA is planning to compare the contributor-supplied checksum/hash value documented in the physical/authentication element to the checksum/hash value of this entity downloaded from previous revisions of this data package. If PASTA already has a copy of this entity, it will be able to avoid an unnecessary download of the entity from your site, resulting in faster processing of the new data package revision when you update it in PASTA.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Add a physical/authentication element and store the entity checksum or hash value in it using a method such as MD5 or SHA-1.

Warn if an entity does not have a physical/authentication element, or if none of the physical/authentication elements specify a method attribute with a value of MD5 or SHA-1.
qualityCheck.expected: At least one physical/authentication element with a method attribute specifying MD5 or SHA-1 and containing a checksum or hash value that can be used to perform an integrity check on the data.
qualityCheck.explanation: PASTA will use this value to check the integrity of the data it downloads from your site. In addition, PASTA is planning to compare the contributor-supplied checksum/hash value documented in the physical/authentication element to the checksum/hash value of this entity downloaded from previous revisions of this data package. If PASTA already has a copy of this entity, it will be able to avoid an unnecessary download of the entity from your site, resulting in faster processing of the new data package revision when you update it in PASTA.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Add a physical/authentication element and store the entity checksum or hash value in it using a method such as MD5 or SHA-1.

qualityCheck.name: dateTime/formatString specified in metadata is from a preferred set of values
qualityCheck.description: Certain features of dateTime data formats are preferred, eg, ISO 8601, 4-digit years. This check looks at metadata to see if the dateTime format is in that preferred list.
qualityCheck.expected: A formatString value that is a member of the preferred set is expected.
qualityCheck.explanation: A preferred format string was found.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Modify the dateTime/formatString, selecting from among the preferred values one that best matches the data format

qualityCheck.name: Check for presence of an entity size element
qualityCheck.description: Look for entity size element as a prep for checking congruence, and if not present, generate a warn. Note that to be most useful (i.e, to check congruence), entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit); however, the presence or name of the entity size unit is NOT checked.
qualityCheck.expected: Entity size is present. If unit="byte" or unit is omitted (default = byte), then congruence can be checked.
qualityCheck.found: Found entity size element with value of 119611 with no unit specified (defaults to 'byte').
qualityCheck.explanation: Examining the entity size is prep for checking congruence. Including the element is best practice, and if not present, a warn is generated. To be most useful, entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit).
qualityCheck.suggestion: Include an entity size in bytes
qualityCheck.reference: Example success: knb-lter-sbc.3.12. Example of size in units other than byte: knb-lter-mcr.6.56.

qualityCheck.name: Check for presence of an entity size element
qualityCheck.description: Look for entity size element as a prep for checking congruence, and if not present, generate a warn. Note that to be most useful (i.e, to check congruence), entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit); however, the presence or name of the entity size unit is NOT checked.
qualityCheck.expected: Entity size is present. If unit="byte" or unit is omitted (default = byte), then congruence can be checked.
qualityCheck.found: Found entity size element with value of 288666 with no unit specified (defaults to 'byte').
qualityCheck.explanation: Examining the entity size is prep for checking congruence. Including the element is best practice, and if not present, a warn is generated. To be most useful, entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit).
qualityCheck.suggestion: Include an entity size in bytes
qualityCheck.reference: Example success: knb-lter-sbc.3.12. Example of size in units other than byte: knb-lter-mcr.6.56.

qualityCheck.name: A physical/authentication element is present and specifies a method attribute with a value of MD5 or SHA-1
qualityCheck.description: Check for presence of a physical/authentication element containing a checksum or hash value for an integrity check (e.g. MD5, SHA-1). Warn if an entity does not have a physical/authentication element, or if none of the physical/authentication elements specify a method attribute with a value of MD5 or SHA-1.
qualityCheck.expected: At least one physical/authentication element with a method attribute specifying MD5 or SHA-1 and containing a checksum or hash value that can be used to perform an integrity check on the data.
qualityCheck.explanation: PASTA will use this value to check the integrity of the data it downloads from your site. In addition, PASTA is planning to compare the contributor-supplied checksum/hash value documented in the physical/authentication element to the checksum/hash value of this entity downloaded from previous revisions of this data package. If PASTA already has a copy of this entity, it will be able to avoid an unnecessary download of the entity from your site, resulting in faster processing of the new data package revision when you update it in PASTA.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Add a physical/authentication element and store the entity checksum or hash value in it using a method such as MD5 or SHA-1.

qualityCheck.expected: A formatString value that is a member of the preferred set is expected.
qualityCheck.explanation: A preferred format string was found.
qualityCheck.suggestion: Modify the dateTime/formatString, selecting from among the preferred values one that best matches the data format
